componentInstanceProperties.value:
This is a retail crowdfunding investment opportunity for retail investors (any 18+ Australian resident) to invest in Picaluna. Picaluna is funeral arranging, reimagined. From a reactive, burdensome and stressful moment in time, to a deeply intentional, rewarding and connected experience.

From a minimum investment of $502.25, this opportunity is open to everyone

Why Picaluna?

  • Own shares in an innovative company changing the way funerals are done for the better. More personal. More compassionate. And importantly, more affordable.
  • Picaluna is growing fast with $2.9M revenue in FY22, up 60% on the previous year.
  • Since their launch, they've conducted over 1,380 funerals and donated in excess of $104,000 to over 170 different charities and causes.
  • An ever-growing community of dedicated, caring funeral celebrants, backed by an experienced management and operations team

Please read this page in detail and the CSF risk warning before investing.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
What is Picaluna?

Picaluna is funeral arranging, reimagined. From a reactive, burdensome and stressful moment in time, to a deeply intentional, rewarding and connected experience.

The Picaluna platform powers this vision, by connecting families, friends and communities to funeral celebrants - the people we entrust to create meaningful ceremonies.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Problem and Market

In Australia, the Funeral industry;

  • Is worth $1.8B per annum,
  • There are approximately 160,000 deaths per annum,
  • There are 9,839 Commonwealth registered celebrants,
  • The personalisation of funerals is a growing trend in Australian society, with 61% viewing funerals as an occasion to honour the departed and recognise their life,
  • Over half the population (60%) would prefer to have a civil celebrant conduct their funeral
Sourced from the Australian Bureau of Statistics, IBIS World Industry Report, and McCrindle Research.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value: The Australian industry is made up of small to medium independent businesses, coupled with two publicly listed companies in Propel Partners and InvoCare (who between them, make up approximately 32% market share).

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Broadly speaking, itâs an industry made up of businesses that are slow to evolve, asset heavy, held back by legacy systems and processes, and have been found to lack transparency in their business dealings. This was highlighted by a CHOICE investigation into the industry:

âIn mid-2019 CHOICE began an extensive investigation into the consumer experience of arranging funerals. Our work found that the funeral industry is rife with poor practices that leave grieving people vulnerable and perhaps worse off. Unclear pricing, misinformation, fees for no service and a highly concentrated market where the true ownership of funeral providers is obfuscated are just some of the poor practices we uncovered.â

Following the ACCC's recent prioritisation of competition and consumer issues in the funeral services sector, we have reviewed reports received from consumers and conducted a survey of consumers and businesses, identifying issues of concern:

  • Lack of transparency and clarity regarding pricing: misleading consumers, eg. where providers do not disclose all costs associated with their services; or label charges in a way that suggests that they are mandatory when that is not the case.
  • Unfair contract terms: including excessive interest rates or late fees for overdue accounts.
  • Claims of being a "local" funeral business: when businesses are in fact subsidiaries of larger corporations
  • Failure to fulfill prior commitments: specifically regarding prepaid funeral products and services
  • Non-disclosure of payments: in return for third-party endorsements from comparison websites or health service providers can mislead consumers and may have a detrimental impact on the broader competitive process.
  • Limiting consumers access to funeral products and services: bundling or tying that may restrict competing businesses' access to customers.
ACCC Funeral Services Sector survey Dec 2021

Funeral celebrants working in the industry are generally paid less than their worth, have little or no creative input into funeral planning, and rely on the funeral businesses for a continued pipeline of work.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Picaluna's Solution

Death is an unavoidable reality, but you have command over what comes next. For families that means choice, time, transparency and affordability. For celebrants, that means a financial reward commensurate with their service, creative freedom, and marketing support to create a pipeline of funerals from their own communities.

Picaluna can make this vision a reality with their tailor-made tech platform, enabling our funeral celebrants to efficiently and effectively arrange funerals.

Price transparency is important to Picaluna and they source everything at cost, applying a 35% Service fee to the wholesale cost of the funeral. They also donate 5% of their profits to the familyâs choice of their Charity partners.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value: .

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Competitive Advantage

Picalunaâs greatest strength is its ever-growing family of funeral celebrants. With 55% of all Picaluna funerals sourced through our celebrantsâ communities, and celebrantsâ deep understanding of what makes meaningful and healing funeral ceremonies, Picaluna is well positioned to grow market share.

The Picaluna model will be attractive to many of the 9,839 registered celebrants across Australia, enabling rapid growth and expansion into new regions.

Picalunaâs other competitive advantages are;

  • Asset light, with the ability to scale at pace,
  • State-of-the-art, proprietary tech platform democratising the funeral arranging process,
  • Transparent business model,
  • The Picaluna Charity Partner programâ¦ giving back to the community with every funeral.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value: .

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Growth Strategy

Society is rapidly changing their views on death and funerals, with more and more people seeking authentic, personalised celebrations of life, officiated by a celebrant.

Picaluna will use the funds to execute our strategic growth plans:

  • Grow funeral arranger numbers via more recruitment and training programs, improve celebrant engagement activities, increase celebrant marketing support,
  • Grow direct-sourced funerals by investing in Search, Social Media, Brand awareness, website upgrades,
  • Upgrade our Tech platform,
  • Recruit new people to bolster Operations, Marketing, and Celebrant Liaison,
  • Expand the business into new territories (i.e. Melbourne, Brisbane), as well as further establishing our footprint in our current operating regions of Greater Sydney, the Central Coast, Newcastle and the Hunter region
  • Enhance our Picaluna Charity Partner program

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Exit Strategy

Picaluna has a three year strategic plan to put them in the best possible position for a potential IPO, Trade sale, Merger or similar.

Over the next 20 years, there will be the biggest increase in Global Death rates the Planet has ever seen, due to an ageing population. By 2030 in Australia, there will be in excess of 5 million people aged 65 or older.

The Offer

The Offer of fully paid ordinary shares in Picaluna Group Pty Ltd at $2.87 per share, to raise a maximum of $500,000.

This crowd-sourced funding (CSF) Offer Document relates to the Offer of fully paid ordinary shares in Picaluna Group Pty Ltd. This Offer is made under the CSF regime in Part 6D.3A of the Corporations Act 2001 (Corporations Act).

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Why Invest Through VentureCrowd?

VentureCrowd is the leading digital investment platform for alternative assets. We find and fund the brightest and most innovative startups.

Our curation and due diligence is rigorous and our track record of success speaks for itself:

  • Only digital investment platform in Australia to have successfully delivered multiple exit returns to investors through equity crowdfunding.

  • 70K+ members and counting.

  • Over $250,000,000 in capital raised since inception.

VentureCrowd is investor-led, which means we only list deals with secured professional external lead investors. Our investors then invest on the same economic terms as professional investors. If you invest in one of our deals you will receive equity or ownership in the company that is raising the capital. Not only will your investment come with lower fees and capital commitments, but it will also come with reduced deal complexity, and youâll have access to alternative equity, property and credit opportunities on the same terms as professional lead investors.

Invest now

Questions?

If you have any questions about this investment offer, please read our Frequently Asked Questions or post your question in the comments section below. If you have any questions about Picaluna, please contact the Picaluna team at: greg@picaluna.com

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Crowd-sourced funding is risky. Issuers using this facility include new or rapidly growing ventures. Investment in these types of ventures is speculative and carries high risks. You may lose your entire investment, and you should be in a position to bear this risk without undue hardship. Even if the company is successful, the value of your investment and any return on the investment could be reduced if the company issues more shares. Your investment is unlikely to be liquid. This means you are unlikely to be able to sell your shares quickly or at all if you need the money or decide that this investment is not right for you. Even though you have remedies for misleading statements in the offer document or misconduct by the company, you may have difficulty recovering your money. There are rules for handling your money. However, if your money is handled inappropriately or the person operating this platform becomes insolvent, you may have difficulty recovering your money. Ask questions, read all information given carefully, and seek independent financial advice before committing yourself to any investment.

This information has been prepared and issued by VentureCrowd Pty Ltd ABN 40 166 598 849 AFSL 503381 (VentureCrowd or we or us). You should consider, with your professional adviser, whether the information is suitable for your circumstances.

While we believe this material is correct, no warranty of accuracy, reliability or completeness is given, except for liability under statute which canât be excluded.
